htmlContent:
BỘ LAO ĐỘNG – THƯƠNG BINH VÀ XÃ HỘI
--------

CỘNG HÒA XÃ HỘI CHỦ NGHĨA VIỆT NAM
Độc lập - Tự do - Hạnh phúc
--------------------

Số: 11/2020/TT-BLĐTBXH

Hà Nội, ngày 12 tháng 11 năm 2020

THÔNG TƯ

BAN HÀNH DANH MỤC NGHỀ, CÔNG VIỆC NẶNG NHỌC, ĐỘC HẠI, NGUY HIỂM VÀ NGHỀ, CÔNG VIỆC ĐẶC BIỆT NẶNG NHỌC, ĐỘC HẠI, NGUY HIỂM

Căn cứ Luật An toàn, vệ sinh lao động ngày 25 tháng 6 năm 2015;

Căn cứ Nghị định số 14/2017/NĐ-CP ngày 17 tháng 02 năm 2107 của Chính phủ quy định chức năng, nhiệm vụ, quyền hạn và cơ cấu tổ chức của Bộ Lao động - Thương binh và Xã hội;

Theo đề nghị của Cục trưởng Cục An toàn lao động;

Bộ trưởng Bộ Lao động - Thương binh và Xã hội ban hành Thông tư ban hành Danh mục nghề, công việc nặng nhọc, độc hại, nguy hiểm và nghề, công việc đặc biệt nặng nhọc, độc hại, nguy hiểm.

Điều 1. Danh mục nghề, công việc nặng nhọc, độc hại, nguy hiểm và nghề, công việc đặc biệt nặng nhọc, độc hại, nguy hiểm

Ban hành kèm theo Thông tư này Danh mục nghề, công việc nặng nhọc, độc hại, nguy hiểm và nghề, công việc đặc biệt nặng nhọc, độc hại, nguy hiểm.

Điều 2. Tổ chức thực hiện

Hằng năm, các bộ quản lý ngành, lĩnh vực, người sử dụng lao động chủ động rà soát, đánh giá Danh mục nghề, công việc nặng nhọc, độc hại, nguy hiểm và nghề, công việc đặc biệt nặng nhọc, độc hại, nguy hiểm theo phương pháp được Bộ trưởng Bộ Lao động - Thương binh và Xã hội quy định để đề xuất sửa đổi, bổ sung Danh mục phù hợp với sự phát triển kinh tế - xã hội, khoa học công nghệ và quản lý trong từng thời kỳ.

Điều 3. Hiệu lực thi hành

1. Thông tư này có hiệu lực kể từ ngày 01 tháng 3 năm 2021.

2. Kể từ ngày Thông tư này có hiệu lực thi hành, các Quyết định, Thông tư sau hết hiệu lực thi hành:

a) Quyết định số 1453/LĐTBXH-QĐ ngày 13 tháng 10 năm 1995 của Bộ trưởng Bộ Lao động - Thương binh và Xã hội về việc ban hành tạm thời danh mục nghề, công việc đặc biệt nặng nhọc, độc hại, nguy hiểm và nặng nhọc, độc hại, nguy hiểm;

b) Quyết định số 915/LĐTBXH-QĐ ngày 30 tháng 7 năm 1996 của Bộ trưởng Bộ Lao động - Thương binh và Xã hội về việc ban hành tạm thời danh mục nghề, công việc đặc biệt nặng nhọc, độc hại, nguy hiểm và nặng nhọc, độc hại, nguy hiểm;

c) Quyết định số 1629/LĐTBXH-QĐ ngày 26 tháng 12 năm 1996 của Bộ trưởng Bộ Lao động - Thương binh và Xã hội về việc ban hành tạm thời danh mục nghề, công việc nặng nhọc, độc hại, nguy hiểm và đặc biệt nặng nhọc, độc hại, nguy hiểm;

d) Quyết định số 190/1999/QĐ-BLĐTBXH ngày 03 tháng 3 năm 1999 của Bộ trưởng Bộ Lao động - Thương binh và Xã hội về việc ban hành tạm thời danh mục nghề, công việc nặng nhọc, độc hại, nguy hiểm và đặc biệt nặng nhọc, độc hại, nguy hiểm;

đ) Quyết định số 1580/2000/QĐ-BLĐTBXH ngày 26 tháng 12 năm 2000 của Bộ trưởng Bộ Lao động - Thương binh và Xã hội về việc ban hành tạm thời danh mục nghề, công việc nặng nhọc, độc hại, nguy hiểm và đặc biệt nặng nhọc, độc hại, nguy hiểm;

e) Quyết định số 1152/2003/QĐ-BLĐTBXH ngày 18 tháng 9 năm 2003 của Bộ trưởng Bộ Lao động - Thương binh và Xã hội về việc ban hành tạm thời danh mục nghề, công việc nặng nhọc, độc hại, nguy hiểm và đặc biệt nặng nhọc, độc hại, nguy hiểm;

g) Thông tư số 36/2012/TT-BLĐTBXH ngày 28 tháng 12 năm 2012 của Bộ trưởng Bộ Lao động - Thương binh và Xã hội ban hành bổ sung danh mục nghề, công việc nặng nhọc độc hại, nguy hiểm và đặc biệt nặng nhọc, độc hại, nguy hiểm;

h) Thông tư số 15/2016/TT-BLĐTBXH ngày 28 tháng 6 năm 2016 của Bộ trưởng Bộ Lao động - Thương binh và Xã hội ban hành Danh mục nghề, công việc nặng nhọc, độc hại, nguy hiểm và đặc biệt nặng nhọc, độc hại, nguy hiểm.

3. Thời gian người lao động làm các nghề, công việc ban hành kèm theo các Quyết định, Thông tư bị bãi bỏ theo quy định tại Khoản 2 Điều này vẫn được tính là thời gian làm các nghề, công việc nặng nhọc, độc hại, nguy hiểm hoặc đặc biệt nặng nhọc, độc hại, nguy hiểm cho đến ngày Thông tư này có hiệu lực.

4. Trong quá trình thực hiện nếu có vướng mắc đề nghị Bộ Lao động - Thương binh và Xã hội để nghiên cứu, giải quyết./.

Nơi nhận:
- Thủ tướng Chính phủ, các Phó Thủ tướng Chính phủ;
- Văn phòng Quốc hội;
- Văn phòng Chủ tịch nước;
- Văn phòng Chính phủ;
- Văn phòng Trung ương và các Ban của Đảng;
- Viện Kiểm sát nhân dân tối cao;
- Tòa án nhân dân tối cao;
- Kiểm toán nhà nước;
- Các Bộ, cơ quan ngang Bộ, cơ quan thuộc Chính phủ;
- Ủy ban Trung ương Mặt trận Tổ quốc Việt Nam;
- Cơ quan Trung ương của các Đoàn thể;
- HĐND, UBND các tỉnh, thành phố trực thuộc Trung ương;
- Sở LĐTBXH các tỉnh, thành phố trực thuộc Trung ương;
- Các Tập đoàn kinh tế và các Tổng công ty hạng đặc biệt;
- Cục Kiểm tra văn bản quy phạm pháp luật (Bộ Tư pháp);
- Công báo; Cổng TTĐT Chính phủ;
- Cổng TTĐT Bộ LĐTBXH;
- Lưu: VT, ATLĐ, PC.

BỘ TRƯỞNG




Đào Ngọc Dung

FILE ĐƯỢC ĐÍNH KÈM THEO VĂN BẢN

MINISTRY OF LABOUR, WAR INVALIDS AND SOCIAL AFFAIRS
----------

SOCIALIST REPUBLIC OF VIETNAM
Independence - Freedom - Happiness
---------------

No.: 11/2020/TT-BLDTBXH

Hanoi, November 12, 2020

 

CIRCULAR

PROMULGATING LIST OF ARDUOUS, HAZARDOUS AND DANGEROUS OCCUPATIONS AND WORKS, AND EXTREMELY ARDUOUS, HAZARDOUS AND DANGEROUS OCCUPATIONS AND WORKS

Pursuant to the Law on occupational safety and hygiene dated June 25, 2015;

Pursuant to the Government’s Decree No. 14/2017/ND-CP dated February 17, 2017 defining the Functions, Tasks, Powers and Organizational Structure of the Ministry of Labour, War Invalids and Social Affairs;

At the request of Director of the Department of Work Safety;

The Minister of Labour, War Invalids and Social Affairs promulgates a Circular promulgating the list of arduous, hazardous and dangerous occupations and works, and extremely arduous, hazardous and dangerous occupations and works.

Article 1. List of arduous, hazardous and dangerous occupations and works, and extremely arduous, hazardous and dangerous occupations and works

The list of arduous, hazardous and dangerous occupations and works, and extremely arduous, hazardous and dangerous occupations and works is enclosed with this Circular.

Article 2. Implementation

Supervisory ministries and employers shall annually review and assess the List of arduous, hazardous and dangerous occupations and works, and extremely arduous, hazardous and dangerous occupations and works, according to the methods announced by the Minister of Labor, War Invalids and Social Affairs, and propose necessary amendments thereof in conformity with social, economic, scientific and technological development, and management policies in each period.

Article 3. Effect

1. This Circular comes into force from March 01, 2021.

2. The following Decisions and Circulars will cease to have effect from the effective date of this Circular:

a) Decision No. 1453/LDTBXH-QD dated October 13, 1995 of the Minister of Labor, War Invalids and Social Affairs;

b) Decision No. 915/LDTBXH-QD dated July 30, 1996 of the Minister of Labor, War Invalids and Social Affairs;

c) Decision No. 1629/LDTBXH-QD dated December 26, 1996 of the Minister of Labor, War Invalids and Social Affairs;

d) Decision No. 190/1999/QD-BLDTBXH dated March 03, 1999 of the Minister of Labor, War Invalids and Social Affairs;

dd) Decision No. 1580/2000/QD-BLDTBXH dated December 26, 2000 of the Minister of Labor, War Invalids and Social Affairs;

e) Decision No. 1152/2003/QD-BLDTBXH dated September 18, 2003 of the Minister of Labor, War Invalids and Social Affairs;

g) Circular No. 36/2012/TT-BLDTBXH dated December 28, 2012 of the Minister of Labor, War Invalids and Social Affairs;

h) Circular No. 15/2016/TT-BLDTBXH dated June 28, 2016 of the Minister of Labor, War Invalids and Social Affairs.

3. The period during which an employee has performed the occupation or work on the lists enclosed with the abrogated decisions or circulars in Clause 2 of this Article shall be also considered as the period for performing arduous, hazardous and dangerous occupations or works or extremely arduous, hazardous and dangerous occupations or works by the effective date of this Circular.

4. Difficulties that arise during the implementation of this Circular should be reported to the Ministry of Labour, War Invalids and Social Affairs for consideration./.

 

 

MINISTER




Dao Ngoc Dung

 

LIST

OF ARDUOUS, HAZARDOUS AND DANGEROUS OCCUPATIONS AND WORKS, AND EXTREMELY ARDUOUS, HAZARDOUS AND DANGEROUS OCCUPATIONS AND WORKS
 (Enclosed with the Circular No. 11/2020/TT-BLDTBXH dated November 12, 2020 of the Minister of Labor, War Invalids and Social Affairs)

I. MINING

No.

Occupation or work

Working conditions

Class-VI working conditions

1

Drilling rock with a hand-held machine hammer in the pit

Working in a confined space lacking light and oxygen; arduous and dangerous work; working under impact of dust, noise and tremor in excess of permissible limits

2

Pit mining

Working in confined space lacking oxygen; manual and extremely arduous and dangerous work; working under impact of dust, noise and CO2.

3

Drying, grinding, mixing and packaging explosives

Hazardous and dangerous work; working in frequent contact with high temperature, noise, dust and toxic chemicals (TNT, Cl2, Licacmon...).

4

Operator of loader or excavator with bucket capacity of at least 8m3

Arduous work; static working posture; working under impact of dust, noise and tremor in excess of permissible limits.

5

Mine rescue team member

Extremely dangerous occupation

6

Extracting non-ferrous metal ores by underground mining method

Working in confined and wet space lacking oxygen; manual and extremely arduous and dangerous work; working under impact of dust, noise and CO2

7

Operating hydrometallurgy and pyrometallurgy equipment (copper, zinc, tin, titanium, chrome, wolfram, etc.).

Working under impact of high temperature, dust, arsenic, noxious gases and chemicals.

Class-V working conditions

1

Drilling to extract rocks by hand-held machine hammer

Working on rocky mountain sides; arduous and dangerous work; working under impact of dust, noise and violent tremor

2

Operating rotary bit drilling rigs or pluggers

Working outdoor; dangerous work; working in frequent contact with noise and dust in excess of permissible limits

3

Electrical and mechanical repairer in the pit

Working in confined space; dangerous work; static working posture; working under impact of noise and coal dust

4

Operating pneumatic fan, electrical, diesel fuel, and battery charging stations in the pit

Working in confined space lacking oxygen; dangerous work; working under impact of dust, noise and heat.

5

Iron worker or drainage worker in the pit

Manual, arduous and dangerous work; working under impact of dust, noise and CO2.

6

Driver or driver’s assistant of coal-carrying train

Dangerous works; working under impact of noise, tremor and dust.

7

Transporting coal in the pit.

Manual, arduous and dangerous work; working under impact of noise, dust and heat.

8

Gas measurement, wind speed measurement, air-gate watch, land survey and quality control in the pit

Arduous and dangerous work; static working posture; working under impact of noise, heat and dust.

9

 Directly providing technical guidance in the pit.

Solving multiple complex works; working at a heat, dust and dangerous workplace.

10

Keeper of blast warehouse in a pit

Hazardous and dangerous work; working under impact of noise, heat and dust

11

Sampling and performing chemical analysis of coal.

Working in frequent contact with heat, dust, CO and other toxic chemicals.

12

Building and repairing mine pathways

Manual and arduous work; working under impact of heat, dust and noise.

13

Operating super and church drilling machines at opencast mines

Arduous and dangerous work; working under impact of dust, noise and violent tremor.

14

Opencast blasting

Arduous and dangerous work; working under impact of dust, noise and NO2.

15

Manual quarrying

Manual, arduous and dangerous work; working under impact of heat, dust and noise; workers are likely to suffer from occupational diseases.

16

Driver, driver’s assistant and escort of vehicles used for transporting explosives.

Arduous and dangerous work; working under impact of noise, tremor and dust.

17

Seafarer, technician, oiler of ships carrying explosives

Arduous and dangerous work; working under impact of wave, noise and tremor.

18

Maintaining, loading and unloading explosives

Manual, arduous and dangerous work; working under impact of dust and noxious gases

19

Explosive testing

Working outdoor; dangerous work; working under impact of noise, dust and NO2.

20

Blasting for extracting kaolin

Working outdoor; arduous and dangerous work; working under impact of noise and soil and rock dust with high content of SiO2

21

Forging machine hammer of at least 1 ton.

Working under impact of high temperature, tremor and noise in excess of permissible limits

22

Giving production guidance in the pit (foreman, vice foreman, pit captain, pit manager).

Solving multiple complex works; working in confined space lacking oxygen; working under impact of dust, noise and CO2

23

Extracting non-ferrous metal ores by opencast or semi-opencast mining.

Manual work; working in a hot space lacking oxygen and in frequent contact with toxic dust.

24

Operating equipment for dressing of non-ferrous metal ores by flotation, gravity concentration, magnetic separation (separating, leaching, etc.)

Working under impact of noise, dust, toxic chemicals, arsenic, metal oxides, etc.

25

Operating ancillary equipment in hydrometallurgy and pyrometallurgy (copper, zinc, tin, titanium, chrome, wolfram, etc.).

Working in frequent contact with high temperature, arsenic, noxious gases and chemicals

26

Supervising safety in the pit; operating and repairing equipment in the pit; operating and assisting operator of electric and battery-powered locomotives in the pit; operating, repairing and charging batteries in the pit; performing acceptance testing of products in the pit; warehouse keeper in the pit; protecting warehouses in the pit; cleaning, dredging pit sediments; transporting materials in the pit; watching signals in the pit; service staff in the pit; installing and repairing communication systems in the pit; operating network station in the pit; guarding wind gate in the pit; measuring gas and wind speed in the pit.

Working in confined space; dangerous work; static working posture; working under impact of noise, coal dust and CO2

27

Electrolysis workers (caring, moving anodes and cathodes, sediments, etc.), producing copper ingots

Working under impact of high temperature, dust, noxious gases; facing high risks of acid burns

28

Processing electrolytic sediments, obtaining precious metal in production of non-ferrous metals

Semi-manual and arduous work; working in frequent contact with high temperature and raw materials which stimulate mucous membrane, eyes, nose and skin.

13

Noodle snacks (grinding, sieving, recycling broken noodles)

Manual work; working in contact with high temperature and dust.

14

Processing chilli sauce

Manual work; working in hot and wet environment, and in contact with chilli (when grinding, cooking, crushing) which may stimulate skin and mucous membrane.

XXXVII. EDUCATION - TRAINING

No.

Occupation or work

Working conditions

 

Class-V working conditions

1

Performing nuclear physics tests

Working in frequent contact with radiation sources

2

Performing radiochemistry tests

Working in frequent contact with radiation sources and toxic chemicals

 

Class-IV working conditions

1

Performing chemical, biological and high voltage tests

Working in closed rooms, and under impact of high electromagnetic field, and in contact with toxic chemicals, high voltage and pathogenic microorganisms

2

Chemical warehouse keepers

Working in closed and confined space, and in contact with toxic chemicals.

XXXVIII. CUSTOMS BRANCH

No.

Occupation or work

Working conditions

 

Class-IV working conditions

1

Operating goods and luggage scanners

Working under impact of radiation and electromagnetic field.

2

Operating imported/exported container scanners

Working under impact of radiation and electromagnetic field.

3

Vessel supervisors.

Working outdoor, and under impact of noise and electromagnetic field.

4

Supervising container depots.

Working outdoor, and under impact of noise and electromagnetic field.

5

Supervising aircraft stands in international airports

Working outdoor, and under impact of noise and electromagnetic field.

6

Using customs speedboats and diesel boats for patrols and prevention of smuggling at sea (captains, first mates, chief engineers, crewmembers).

Working under impact of waves, wind, noise, tremor and heat; static working posture; working in frequent contact with gasoline and oil

7

Training and using detection dogs to detect drugs, weapons, explosives and prevent smuggling and illegal transport of goods across the border

Working in frequent contact with sources of pathogens from detection dogs, wastes, and pathogenic bacteria

8

Analyzing, classifying exported and imported goods (working in laboratories, contacting and using chemicals).

Working in frequent contact toxic chemicals, noise and chemical dust.

9

Keeping and preserving chemicals serving the analysis and classification of exported and imported goods

Arduous work; working under impact of toxic chemicals, and chemical dust.

XXXIX. AUTOMOBILE AND MOTORCYCLE PRODUCTION

No.

Occupation or work

Working conditions

 

Class-V working conditions

1

Melting and pouring metals.

Working in dusty, hot, noisy environment with toxic gases; intensive work.

 

Class-IV working conditions

1

Performing arc welding or gas welding in motorcycle manufacture.

Requiring prompt movements; static working posture; carrying heavy objects throughout the shift; working under impact of toxic gases

2

Moving chassis and engines in motorcycle production line.

Requiring prompt movements; arduous work; static working posture; constantly bending the body.

3

Test-driving motorcycles outdoor.

Outdoor and stressful work; working under impact of noise, dust and toxic gases.

4

Processing and collecting paint sludge

Working in frequent contact with organic solvents; static working posture; transporting heavy objects during the shift.

5

Checking and forming vehicle chassis in motorcycle production line.

Requiring prompt movements; static working posture; constantly bending the body.

6

Operating shot blasting machines in automobile and motorcycle manufacture

Working under impact of toxic gases, partial tremor; static working posture; bending and carrying heavy objects.

7

Operating metal degating machines

Working under impact of dust, heat, noise, toxic gases, partial tremor; static working posture; bending and carrying heavy objects.

8

Operating machines to coat paint mould surfaces

Working under impact of dust, heat, noise and organic solvents; static working posture; bending the body.

9

Spraying paint in the automobile, motorcycle production line.

Hazardous work; working in frequent contact with organic solvents

10

Operating metal punching machines.

Monotonous work; optical strain; working under impact of loud noise and tremor.

11

Mixing paint in automobile and motorcycle manufacture

Working in frequent contact with organic solvents; constant movements; transporting heavy objects during the shift.

12

Classifying and treating wastes.

Manual work; working under impact of high temperature and in frequent contact with toxic substances.

13

Dispensing fuel and operating reformulated gasoline systems

Arduous work; working in frequent contact with gasoline and oil in excess of permissible limits; static working posture.

14

Mixing sand for making moulds.

Arduous work; working under impact of heat, toxic gases, dust, noise, partial tremor; static working posture; bending the body.

15

Breaking moulds

Arduous work; working under impact of heat, dust and tremor; static working posture.

16

Die casting of aluminum, copper.

Working under impact of heat, dust, tremor, toxic gases, noise; static working posture; bending and carrying heavy objects.

17

Dry grinding and cleaning castings.

Working in contact with dust, tremor and noise; static working posture; bending

18

Operating oil paint driers.

Working in hot  environment; facing high risk of fire and explosion; working under impact of thermal radiation, and in frequent contact with solvents

19

Operating anti-rust paint driers.

Working in hot environment; facing high risk of fire and explosion; working under impact of thermal radiation, and in frequent contact with solvents.

20

Operating gloss painting chambers

Working in frequent contact with organic solvents; static working posture; carrying heavy objects during the shift.

21

Driving cranes and repairing molds

Working in hot environment, and under impact of toxic gases, dust, noise; intensive work; static working posture; bending the body.

22

Operating and maintaining welding equipment in motorcycle production line.

Working under impact of loud noise and toxic gases; stressful work; static working posture.

XL. ARCHIVES

No.

Occupation or work

Working conditions

 

Class-IV working conditions

1

Directly performing storage works at storing warehouses/ rooms, or storage technical workshops.

Working under impact of dust, chemicals, molds and fungi, and harmful microorganisms.

XLI. NATURAL RESOURCES AND ENVIRONMENT

No.

Occupation or work

Working conditions

 

Class-VI working conditions

1

Surveying, measuring and drawing maps of natural resources at sea and on islands

Arduous and dangerous work; frequently working at sea, and under impact of bad weather, tremor and noise.

2

Diving to take research samples, collect information about natural conditions and seabed environment.

Arduous and dangerous work; static working posture; working under impact of high pressure.

 

Class-V working conditions

1

Operating ships for surveying natural resources and environment at sea and on islands

Arduous, dangerous and stressful work; frequently working at sea; working under impact of bad weather and noise; stressful work.

2

Performing seabed drilling operations (on jack-up rigs, buoys, ships, vessels)

Outdoor and stressful work; working under impact of noise and tremor.

3

Performing monitoring of natural conditions, dynamics, environment and ecology of sea.

Outdoor and stressful work; working under impact of noise and tremor.

4

Measuring spectroscopy of gamma-rays on ships.

Outdoor and stressful work; working under impact of noise and tremor.

5

Conducting marine geophysical surveys by ships (seismism, magnetic, gravity, sonar, eletromagnetism).

Outdoor and stressful work; working under impact of noise and tremor.

6

Conducting geophysical surveys in radioactive zones in water resources sector.

Working outdoor in highlands; a lot of travel; working under impact of radiation.

7

Conducting well logging in water resources sector.

Extremely dangerous work; working in contact with high-intensity unsealed radioactive sources.

8

Investigating water resources in highland, forest, island and border regions, and at sea.

Working outdoor, in complex terrains; muddy workplace; arduous work; working under impact of bad weather, noise and tremor.

9

Working out routes for preparing maps of water resources, monitoring of water resources, searching for water sources at remote, highland, border regions, and on islands.

Working outdoor; arduous and dangerous work; constantly moving in high and sloping mountainous regions.

10

Monitoring and taking samples of radioactive environment, sediments, dioxin/furan, and other toxic chemicals.

Working outdoor, at steep and dangerous regions; manual work; a lot of travel; working in contact with toxic chemicals.

11

Carrying out analysis of environmental parameters of oil, water, gas, radioactive, sediment, sewage sludge, hazardous waste, dioxin/furan and other toxic chemicals.

Working in direct contact with chemicals; working under impact of radiation rays and noise.

12

Performing monitoring of water resources in remote, highland, border or island regions.

Working outdoor; arduous and stressful work; constantly moving; stressful work.

 

Class-IV working conditions

1

Performing monitoring in coastal regions (measuring magnetic variations during both day and night, monitoring tidal fluctuations, gravimetric reference stations, measuring and connecting geodetic points serving marine investigation projects).

Outdoor and stressful work; working under impact of noise and tremor.

2

Operating drillers to extract water.

Working outdoor; arduous work; muddy workplace; static working posture; working in contact with chemicals contained in bentonites.

3

Operating drilling rigs or trucks of at least 7,5 tonnes to extract water.

Dangerous work; working under impact of tremor and noise.

4

Analyzing and testing physical – mechanical features of soil & rock, material physical – mechanical features, and physical chemistry of water.

Working in frequent contact with dust and toxic chemicals.

5

Performing monitoring of water resources at monitoring stations in flat or midland areas.

Working outdoor; arduous work; constantly moving.

6

Selecting, classifying, maintaining, repairing or restoring materials stored at National Center for Water Resources Planning and Investigation.

Working in frequent contact with CO and formaldehyde.

7

Taking/ pouring laboratory water for doing researches on water resources.

Working outdoor; manual and arduous work.

8

Pumping water into/from boreholes.

Working outdoor; manual and arduous work.

9

Instructing and inspecting monitoring techniques at monitoring stations and points in mountainous and island regions.

Arduous work; a lot of travel.   

10

Performing monitoring of water-flow rate and hydrologic factors at water resource monitoring stations in mountainous regions.

Arduous and dangerous work.

XLII. RUBBER

No.

Occupation or work

Working conditions

 

Class-V working conditions

1

Spraying pesticides for rubber plantations

Working outdoor; arduous and hazardous work; working in contact with pesticides in excess of permissible limits

2

Harvesting rubber latex

Working outdoor; arduous and dangerous work; working under impact of pesticides

3

Processing rubber latex

Working in a wet place; manual and extremely arduous work; working under impact of loud noise and toxic chemicals such as NH3, acetic acid, formic acid

4

Soaking rubber timber into chemicals for preventing termites and woodworms

Manual and arduous work; working under impact of toxic chemicals such as Borax, Boric, f-Clean, etc.

 

Class-IV working conditions

1

Vulcanizing rubber products.

Working in contact with high temperature, chemicals and unpleasant odors for a long time; facing high risk of thermal burns.

2

Planting and caring rubber trees

Outdoor, manual and arduous work; static working posture; working under impact of dust and pathogenic microorganisms

3

Driving vehicles transporting rubber latex

Arduous, stressful, noisy, shaking and dangerous work; Cleaning rubber latex tanks daily; static working posture; working in contact with rubber late and toxic chemicals (acids). Working in contact with rubber latex.

4

Protecting lots of rubber trees

Frequently patrolling within the lot, under bad weather conditions; facing risk of being attacked by rubber latex thieves

5

Rubber tapping managers (team leaders)

Working in the same environment as rubber tapping workers; works are less arduous than those of workers.

6

Loading rubber latex in rubber plantations

Working in a wet place; manual and extremely arduous work; selecting and unloading rubber latex; working under impact of toxic chemicals such as NH3, formic acid, etc.

7

Repairing and maintain electromechanic systems in rubber latex processing plants

Working under impact of chemicals such as acids and bases, waste lubricants and unpleasant odors from rubber latex; static working posture.

8

Driving lifting equipment in rubber latex processing plants

Working in frequent contact with chemicals, unpleasant odors from rubber latex

9

Protecting rubber latex processing plants

Daily contacting unpleasant odors from rubber latex; working in the same environment with rubber latex processing workers.

10

Quality control staff

Working in frequent contact with chemicals, and rubber latex

11

Logging, sawing and cutting rubber timber in plantations by mechanical equipment and portable sawmills

Outdoor and arduous work; working in hot and wet environment with limited lighting, loud   noise and tremor; working in contact with harmful microorganisms.

12

Sawing and splitting rubber timber in workshops by mechanical equipment (sawing machine, circular saw)

Working under impact of loud noise, tremor and sawdust. Facing risk of saw blade fractures.

13

Operating steam boilers for drying rubber timber

Boilers are subject to periodical inspection. Working with high temperature; facing risk of incidents and toxic chemicals.

14

Laminating, refining rubber latex for producing rubber products

Arduous and hazardous work; working in contact with high temperature, dust, SO2, H2S in excess of permissible limits.

15

Treating sewage in rubber latex processing plants.

Working outdoor and in contact with toxic chemicals. Working in place with many dangerous lakes and deep ditches. Working in frequent contact with toxic chemicals used in sewage treatment; working at night shifts according to operation of the rubber latex processing plant.

**MINISTRY OF LABOUR, WAR INVALIDS AND SOCIAL AFFAIRS  
\----------**

**SOCIALIST REPUBLIC OF VIETNAM  
Independence - Freedom - Happiness  
\---------------**

No.: 11/2020/TT-BLDTBXH

_Hanoi, November 12, 2020_

**CIRCULAR**
============

PROMULGATING LIST OF ARDUOUS, HAZARDOUS AND DANGEROUS OCCUPATIONS AND WORKS, AND EXTREMELY ARDUOUS, HAZARDOUS AND DANGEROUS OCCUPATIONS AND WORKS

_Pursuant to the Law on occupational safety and hygiene dated June 25, 2015;_

_Pursuant to the Government’s Decree No. [14/2017/ND-CP](https://thuvienphapluat.vn/van-ban/bo-may-hanh-chinh/decree-14-2017-nd-cp-functions-tasks-organizational-structure-ministry-labor-war-invalids-social-affairs-343447.aspx "Decree of Government 14/2017/ND-CP") dated February 17, 2017 defining the Functions, Tasks, Powers and Organizational Structure of the Ministry of Labour, War Invalids and Social Affairs;_

_At the request of Director of the Department of Work Safety;_

_The Minister of Labour, War Invalids and Social Affairs promulgates a Circular promulgating the list of arduous, hazardous and dangerous occupations and works, and extremely arduous, hazardous and dangerous occupations and works._

**Article 1. List of arduous, hazardous and dangerous occupations and works, and extremely arduous, hazardous and dangerous occupations and works**
===================================================================================================================================================

The list of arduous, hazardous and dangerous occupations and works, and extremely arduous, hazardous and dangerous occupations and works is enclosed with this Circular.

**Article 2. Implementation**

Supervisory ministries and employers shall annually review and assess the List of arduous, hazardous and dangerous occupations and works, and extremely arduous, hazardous and dangerous occupations and works, according to the methods announced by the Minister of Labor, War Invalids and Social Affairs, and propose necessary amendments thereof in conformity with social, economic, scientific and technological development, and management policies in each period.

**Article 3. Effect**

1\. This Circular comes into force from March 01, 2021.

2\. The following Decisions and Circulars will cease to have effect from the effective date of this Circular:

a) Decision No. [1453/LDTBXH-QD](https://thuvienphapluat.vn/van-ban/lao-dong-tien-luong/decision-no-1453-ldtbxh-qd-on-promulgating-the-provisional-list-of-occupation-127138.aspx "Decision 1453/LDTBXH-QD") dated October 13, 1995 of the Minister of Labor, War Invalids and Social Affairs;

b) Decision No. [915/LDTBXH-QD](https://thuvienphapluat.vn/van-ban/lao-dong-tien-luong/decision-no-915-ldtbxh-qd-promulgating-the-provisional-list-of-jobs-and-works-154053.aspx "Decision 915/LDTBXH-QD") dated July 30, 1996 of the Minister of Labor, War Invalids and Social Affairs;

c) Decision No. [1629/LDTBXH-QD](https://thuvienphapluat.vn/van-ban/lao-dong-tien-luong/decision-no-1629-ldtbxh-qd-1996-provisional-list-of-arduous-toxic-dangerous-works-200921.aspx "Decision 1629/LDTBXH-QD") dated December 26, 1996 of the Minister of Labor, War Invalids and Social Affairs;

d) Decision No. [190/1999/QD-BLDTBXH](https://thuvienphapluat.vn/van-ban/lao-dong-tien-luong/decision-190-1999-qd-bldtbxh-list-of-arduous-harmful-and-dangerous-works-205164.aspx "Decision 190/1999/QD-BLDTBXH") dated March 03, 1999 of the Minister of Labor, War Invalids and Social Affairs;

dd) Decision No. [1580/2000/QD-BLDTBXH](https://thuvienphapluat.vn/van-ban/lao-dong-tien-luong/decision-no-1580-2000-qd-bldtbxh-on-the-temporary-issuance-of-list-of-occupation-133528.aspx "Decision 1580/2000/QD-BLDTBXH") dated December 26, 2000 of the Minister of Labor, War Invalids and Social Affairs;

e) Decision No. [1152/2003/QD-BLDTBXH](https://thuvienphapluat.vn/van-ban/bao-hiem/decision-no-1152-2003-qd-bldtbxh-of-minister-of-labour-war-invalids-127241.aspx "Decision 1152/2003/QD-BLDTBXH") dated September 18, 2003 of the Minister of Labor, War Invalids and Social Affairs;

g) Circular No. [36/2012/TT-BLDTBXH](https://thuvienphapluat.vn/van-ban/lao-dong-tien-luong/circular-36-2012-tt-bldtbxh-list-of-arduous-toxic-dangerous-works-204453.aspx "Circular 36/2012/TT-BLDTBXH") dated December 28, 2012 of the Minister of Labor, War Invalids and Social Affairs;

h) Circular No. [15/2016/TT-BLDTBXH](https://thuvienphapluat.vn/van-ban/lao-dong-tien-luong/circular-15-2016-tt-bldtbxh-list-extremely-arduous-hazardous-dangerous-occupations-342506.aspx "Circular 15/2016/TT-BLDTBXH") dated June 28, 2016 of the Minister of Labor, War Invalids and Social Affairs.

3\. The period during which an employee has performed the occupation or work on the lists enclosed with the abrogated decisions or circulars in Clause 2 of this Article shall be also considered as the period for performing arduous, hazardous and dangerous occupations or works or extremely arduous, hazardous and dangerous occupations or works by the effective date of this Circular.

4\. Difficulties that arise during the implementation of this Circular should be reported to the Ministry of Labour, War Invalids and Social Affairs for consideration./.

**MINISTER  
  
  
  
  
Dao Ngoc Dung**

**LIST**

OF ARDUOUS, HAZARDOUS AND DANGEROUS OCCUPATIONS AND WORKS, AND EXTREMELY ARDUOUS, HAZARDOUS AND DANGEROUS OCCUPATIONS AND WORKS  
 _(Enclosed with the Circular No. 11/2020/TT-BLDTBXH dated November 12, 2020 of the Minister of Labor, War Invalids and Social Affairs)_

**I. MINING**

**No.**

**Occupation or work**

**Working conditions**

**Class-VI working conditions**

1

Drilling rock with a hand-held machine hammer in the pit

Working in a confined space lacking light and oxygen; arduous and dangerous work; working under impact of dust, noise and tremor in excess of permissible limits

2

Pit mining

Working in confined space lacking oxygen; manual and extremely arduous and dangerous work; working under impact of dust, noise and CO2.

3

Drying, grinding, mixing and packaging explosives

Hazardous and dangerous work; working in frequent contact with high temperature, noise, dust and toxic chemicals (TNT, Cl2, Licacmon...).

4

Operator of loader or excavator with bucket capacity of at least 8m3

Arduous work; static working posture; working under impact of dust, noise and tremor in excess of permissible limits.

5

Mine rescue team member

Extremely dangerous occupation

6

Extracting non-ferrous metal ores by underground mining method

Working in confined and wet space lacking oxygen; manual and extremely arduous and dangerous work; working under impact of dust, noise and CO2

7

Operating hydrometallurgy and pyrometallurgy equipment (copper, zinc, tin, titanium, chrome, wolfram, etc.).

Working under impact of high temperature, dust, arsenic, noxious gases and chemicals.

**Class-V working conditions**

1

Drilling to extract rocks by hand-held machine hammer

Working on rocky mountain sides; arduous and dangerous work; working under impact of dust, noise and violent tremor

2

Operating rotary bit drilling rigs or pluggers

Working outdoor; dangerous work; working in frequent contact with noise and dust in excess of permissible limits

3

Electrical and mechanical repairer in the pit

Working in confined space; dangerous work; static working posture; working under impact of noise and coal dust

4

Operating pneumatic fan, electrical, diesel fuel, and battery charging stations in the pit

Working in confined space lacking oxygen; dangerous work; working under impact of dust, noise and heat.

5

Iron worker or drainage worker in the pit

Manual, arduous and dangerous work; working under impact of dust, noise and CO2.

6

Driver or driver’s assistant of coal-carrying train

Dangerous works; working under impact of noise, tremor and dust.

7

Transporting coal in the pit.

Manual, arduous and dangerous work; working under impact of noise, dust and heat.

8

Gas measurement, wind speed measurement, air-gate watch, land survey and quality control in the pit

Arduous and dangerous work; static working posture; working under impact of noise, heat and dust.

9

 Directly providing technical guidance in the pit.

Solving multiple complex works; working at a heat, dust and dangerous workplace.

10

Keeper of blast warehouse in a pit

Hazardous and dangerous work; working under impact of noise, heat and dust

11

Sampling and performing chemical analysis of coal.

Working in frequent contact with heat, dust, CO and other toxic chemicals.

12

Building and repairing mine pathways

Manual and arduous work; working under impact of heat, dust and noise.

13

Operating super and church drilling machines at opencast mines

Arduous and dangerous work; working under impact of dust, noise and violent tremor.

14

Opencast blasting

Arduous and dangerous work; working under impact of dust, noise and NO2.

15

Manual quarrying

Manual, arduous and dangerous work; working under impact of heat, dust and noise; workers are likely to suffer from occupational diseases.

16

Driver, driver’s assistant and escort of vehicles used for transporting explosives.

Arduous and dangerous work; working under impact of noise, tremor and dust.

17

Seafarer, technician, oiler of ships carrying explosives

Arduous and dangerous work; working under impact of wave, noise and tremor.

18

Maintaining, loading and unloading explosives

Manual, arduous and dangerous work; working under impact of dust and noxious gases

19

Explosive testing

Working outdoor; dangerous work; working under impact of noise, dust and NO2.

20

Blasting for extracting kaolin

Working outdoor; arduous and dangerous work; working under impact of noise and soil and rock dust with high content of SiO2

21

Forging machine hammer of at least 1 ton.

Working under impact of high temperature, tremor and noise in excess of permissible limits

22

Giving production guidance in the pit (foreman, vice foreman, pit captain, pit manager).

Solving multiple complex works; working in confined space lacking oxygen; working under impact of dust, noise and CO2

23

Extracting non-ferrous metal ores by opencast or semi-opencast mining.

Manual work; working in a hot space lacking oxygen and in frequent contact with toxic dust.

24

Operating equipment for dressing of non-ferrous metal ores by flotation, gravity concentration, magnetic separation (separating, leaching, etc.)

Working under impact of noise, dust, toxic chemicals, arsenic, metal oxides, etc.

25

Operating ancillary equipment in hydrometallurgy and pyrometallurgy (copper, zinc, tin, titanium, chrome, wolfram, etc.).

Working in frequent contact with high temperature, arsenic, noxious gases and chemicals

26

Supervising safety in the pit; operating and repairing equipment in the pit; operating and assisting operator of electric and battery-powered locomotives in the pit; operating, repairing and charging batteries in the pit; performing acceptance testing of products in the pit; warehouse keeper in the pit; protecting warehouses in the pit; cleaning, dredging pit sediments; transporting materials in the pit; watching signals in the pit; service staff in the pit; installing and repairing communication systems in the pit; operating network station in the pit; guarding wind gate in the pit; measuring gas and wind speed in the pit.

Working in confined space; dangerous work; static working posture; working under impact of noise, coal dust and CO2

27

Electrolysis workers (caring, moving anodes and cathodes, sediments, etc.), producing copper ingots

Working under impact of high temperature, dust, noxious gases; facing high risks of acid burns

28

Processing electrolytic sediments, obtaining precious metal in production of non-ferrous metals

Working in frequent contact with high temperature, arsenic, noxious gases and metal oxides, etc.

29

Repairing non-ferrous metal melting and smelting furnaces

Working in frequent contact with high temperature, arsenic, noxious gases and metal oxides, etc.

30

Keeping industrial hygiene in production of non-ferrous metals

Manual work; working in frequent contact with heat, toxic dusts, noxious gases and other solvents

31

Workers in charge of mixing and pouring concrete inside the pits.

Working in confined space lacking oxygen; static working posture; working under impact of noise, heat and dust.

32

Performing mine gas monitoring in the pit.

Frequently working in the pit, in confined and dangerous space lacking oxygen; static working posture; working under impact of noise, heat and dust.

33

Driving graders and bulldozers of a capacity of at least 180 CV

Static working posture; working under impact of dust, noise and tremor.

34

Operating shell and tube heat exchangers in silicon pretreatment, alkali tanks, silicon treatment for alumina plants

Working under impact of high temperature, alkali vapor and radioactive substances, and noise in excess of permissible limits

35

Operating shell and tube heat exchangers in separation areas; vapor separation at alumina plants

Working under impact of high temperature, alkali vapor and radioactive substances, and noise in excess of permissible limits

36

Operating the hydrate filtration and alumina melting chamber

Arduous and hazardous work; working under impact of heat radiation, CO, noise and tremor in excess of permissible limits

37

Operating coal gasification furnace

Working under impact of heat, noise, tremor, dust with high content of H2; CO; CO2

**Class-IV working conditions**

1

Operating iron-ore dressing slurry pump in the pit

Working in deep pit, muddy and confined space lacking light, and under impact of noise.

2

Operating rotary shifters in iron ore dressing.

Working on the shifter, under impact of noise

3

Operating coarse crusher in iron ore dressing.

Working in deep pit, muddy and confined space lacking light, and under impact of noise.

4

Operating conveyor belt in dressing of underground iron ore mine

Arduous work with noise

5

Operating vibrating shifter in iron ore dressing.

Working under impact of noise and vibration

6

Operating ball mill crusher in ore dressing.

Muddy and wet working conditions; working under impact of noise

7

Operating medium-size crusher in ore dressing.

Working in frequent contact with noise Working on the floor, constantly moving

8

Operating water gun used in ore dressing

Arduous work; working in confined and wet space with noise

9

Electrical and mechanical repairing at opencast mines

Static working posture; working under impact of noise, lubricants and dust

10

Operating dewatering pump under the pit

Working under impact of noise, vibration and heat

11

Manually washing and screening, manually extracting coal at opencast mines

Arduous work; working outdoor and under impact of noise and dust

12

Operating conveyor belt, crusher, coal/rock sieve; operating coal chutes. 

Arduous work; working under impact of noise, tremor and dust in excess of permissible limits.

13

Guarding, delivering, warehouse keeper/ assistant at explosives manufacturing facility

Working at dangerous and poorly ventilated space, and under impact of toxic gases and dust

14

Testing on explosives

Working in frequent contact with chemicals and toxic dust

15

Driving explosives lifting machine

Working under impact of toxic chemicals and dust

16

Electrical and mechanical repairing of explosives manufacturing equipment

Static working posture; working under impact of petro, oil, toxic dust and chemicals

17

Industrial cleaning of explosives manufacturing facility

Manual and arduous work; working under impact of toxic dust and chemicals

18

Directly providing production guidance and inspecting quality of explosives.

Working in frequent contact with chemicals and toxic dust

19

Driving graders and bulldozers of a capacity of less than 180 CV

Working under impact of heat, noise, dust and vibration

20

Operating loader or excavator with bucket capacity of less than 4 m3.

Working under impact of heat, noise, dust and vibration

21

Operating stone crushing and screening machine

Working outdoor and under impact of noise, tremor and dust of very high content.

22

Driving coal/stone-carrying vehicle in a mining area

Arduous and dangerous work; working under impact of noise, tremor and dust in excess of permissible limits.

23

Making paper tubes for explosive packaging

Working under impact of heat and toxic chemicals during the shift

24

Manually extracting kaolin at opencast mines

Working outdoor; manual and arduous work; working under impact of hot, cold, wind at deep pit, and stone dust with high content of SiO2

25

Manually processing kaolin

Working outdoor; arduous, manual and monotonous work; working under impact of soil and rock dust with high content of SiO2

26

Operating grue portique/gantry crane, coal loading/unloading machines at coal washing and screening plant.

Working at height and under impact of sunlight, heat and dust; stressful work.

27

Operating dump car at coal washing and screening plant

Working outdoor and under impact of sunlight, heat and coal dust in excess of permissible limits.

28

Electrical and mechanical repairing at coal washing and screening plant

Arduous work; static working posture; working in frequent contact with lubricants, coal dust, high temperature, tremor and noise in excess of permissible limits
